body_html: @dimeldo the pytorch usage pattern doesn't have a tf.gradients like part usually. We do output.backward(). This PR's provision checkpoint and checkpoint_sequential can be used as drop-in replacements for your existing sequential style models or time-series style models.

body: @dimeldo the pytorch usage pattern doesn't have a `tf.gradients` like part usually. We do `output.backward()`. This PR's provision `checkpoint` and `checkpoint_sequential` can be used as drop-in replacements for your existing sequential style models or time-series style models.
